page.title: 04WATERWAYS AND LAND DRAINAGE
page.content: To the east is the River Parrett and the Bridgwater to Taunton canal- they both flow through farmland and the town of Bridgwater. The canal is no longer used commercially because it is too slow a method of transportation, Motorways and the railway network are a more speedy and economic way of delivering goods. Because it has fallen into disuse, wild life abounds along its banks. The River Parrett is also not used commerically in this area. A new pumping station built in l979 on the edge of the river comes into action when Stock Moor Rhyne becomes too full pumping water into the River Parrett. This is a new industrial estate which is still developing.
